March 7, 2024

Governor Hochul Announces Start of Project to Enhance Passenger Experience at Syracuse Hancock International Airport

  • Learn More
  • More Infrastructure News

New York State is making historic investments in infrastructure, from transportation to clean energy projects and beyond. Below is summary of funding that has been dedicated to New York through the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law and Inflation Reduction Act.

  • $22.6 Billion

    Transportation

  • $2.1 Billion

    Water

  • $1.8 Billion

    Broadband

  • $1.8 Billion

    Clean Energy and Power

  • $776 Million

    Conservation and Environment

  • $746 Million

    Safety

  • $596 Million

    Resilience

  • $59 Million

    Other

This data is derived from the White House’s Investing in America website and reflects investments made in New York through the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law and Inflation Reduction Act. Note that this data is intended to be illustrative of federal investments in New York and is not exhaustive; funding for certain programs may not be captured by the White House’s data and therefore is not reflected here. The “Other” category of projects includes certain agricultural, community development, and Tribal projects. Data last updated on December 16, 2024.

BIL Funding Announced for New York

Below is a summary of Bipartisan Infrastructure Law funding that has been announced and is headed to communities all across New York, including rural communities and historically underserved populations.

  • $22.6 Billion

    Transportation

  • $2.1 Billion

    Water

  • $1.8 Billion

    Broadband

  • $746 Million

    Safety

  • $764 Million

    Clean Energy and Power

  • $592 Million

    Resilience

  • $189 Million

    Environmental Remediation

  • $54 Million

    Other

This data is derived from the White House’s Investing in America website and reflects investments made in New York through the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law. Note that this data is intended to be illustrative of federal investments in New York and is not exhaustive; funding for certain programs may not be captured by the White House’s data and therefore is not reflected here. The “Other” category of projects includes certain community development and Tribal projects. Data last updated on December 16, 2024.

IRA Funding Announced for New York

Below is a summary of Inflation Reduction Act funding that has been announced for New York to support clean energy, climate mitigation and resilience, agriculture, and conservation-related investment programs.

  • $991 Million

    Clean Energy and Buildings

  • $491 Million

    Environmental Remediation

  • $89 Million

    Parks and Conservation

  • $7 Million

    Climate Smart Agriculture

  • $6 Million

    Other

  • $6 Million

    Transportation

  • $4 Million

    Resilience

This data is derived from the White House’s Investing in America website and reflects investments made in New York through the Inflation Reduction Act. Note that this data is intended to be illustrative of federal investments in New York and is not exhaustive; funding for certain programs may not be captured by the White House’s data and therefore is not reflected here. The “Other” category of projects includes certain community development and Tribal projects. Data last updated on December 16, 2024.
